todos.title: Are expense categories exhaustive and do they match the building plans
Did you approach financing early to avoid cash flow issues
Did you ask each subcontractor exactly what would be included in there scope of work
Did you ask subcontractor if there were additional items that needed to be done after their work to achieve a 'finished product'
Did you meet subcontractors at site to explain and point out exactly what you want (do not communicate scope of work over phone)
Did you proactively call subcontractors to determine which items have lead times and need to be pre-ordered (i.e. appliances, fixtures, doors, countertops)
Is there an allowance for sales, occupational, property  taxes included
Was a standard acceptance form used to avoid errors in misunderstanding and fine print
Was research done on cost of similar construction jobs
Were you aggressive in finding subcontractors that are freelance or do not have huge overhead costs
